result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:19 PM (64-06) Defendant Sharilyn R Chironis in court.  Attorney Andrew Walter in court for Sharilyn R Chironis.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open Court.
Defense acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CF539, 22CF504 & 21CF279

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Attorney Walter in court for Sharilyn R Chironis.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin.  Matter originally set for plea sentencing on older case, 2 new cases filed. Prelim to be set, waiving time limits. Initial appearance on new cases. Charges / penalties explained. Bond to be addressed. ADA Crawford request new bond be set and total 10,000 to cover all files and forfeit prior bond. Court does enter judgment on bond forfeiture and is totaling all files, 10,000 ROR with same prior conditions.
Court in recess at 303 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
